intro: Pseudolysimachion kiusianum var. diamantiacum, commonly known as the Diamantine Starflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth texture, and the stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is considered a valuable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
